externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's Event Center API

post.description: Creates an event with the specified parameters.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Event Center API

schema.description: Contains information about the request body parameters that you can specify when creating an event. It also includes tags and objects that you can associate with a new event and the recurrence context for the event.

audienceLocations.description: A list of two-letter ISO 3166 country codes that indicate geographic areas of audiences. This array can be up to 20 unique items.

audienceSize.description: The audience's size for the event. The minimum value is 1.

coordinators.description: A list of up to 20 Luna Control Center usernames of those who serve as the event's coordinators.

customerEventId.description: The user-specified ID for the event. This ID can be up to 100 characters long. [Customer Event ID](https://techdocs.akamai.com/event-ctr/docs/concepts).

description.description: The description of the event. This description can be up to 2000 characters long.

end.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the end date of the event.

name.description: The name of the event. This name can be up to 750 characters long.

objects.description: A collection of objects associated with the event. This array can include only unique items.

items.description: Contains information about the domain object related to an Akamai product that you can associate with the event.

bitrates.description: A list of expected bit rates in kbit/s for the stream. Specify for `FLASH_LIVE_STREAM`, `UNIVERSAL_LIVE_STREAM`, and `MSL4_STREAM` objects. This array can be up to 20 unique items.

id.description: The identifier of the object.

type.description: The type of object for the event. Use `QOS_REPORT_PACK` for quality report pack, `CP_CODE` for a Content Provider code, `SRIP_SLOT` for a Sure Route IP slot, `FLASH_LIVE_STREAM` for a Flash Live stream, `UNIVERSAL_LIVE_STREAM` for a Universal Live stream, or `MSL4_STREAM` for Media Services Live v4.1 stream.

recurrence.description: Contains information about the recurrence parameters that you can specify when creating the event.

count.description: The number of times to repeat the event. Specify a value between 1 and 366.

frequency.description: The periodicity of the recurring event. Use `HOURLY` to repeat the event once an hour, `DAILY` to repeat the event once a day, `WEEKLY` to repeat the event once a week, or `MONTHLY` to repeat the event once a month.

start.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the start date of the event.

tags.description: A list of tags associated with the event. A tag can be up to 100 characters long. This array can be up to 20 unique items.

schema.description: Contains details of an event.

items.description: A collection of details about an event.

audienceLocations.description: A collection of countries that match the geographic locations of audiences.

items.description: Provides information about a country that matches the geographic area of an audience.

name.description: Name of the country that corresponds to the country code.

audienceSize.description: The audience's size for the event.

coordinators.description: A collection of coordinators assigned to the event.

items.description: Contains information about the event's coordinator.

userName.description: The coordinator's username as defined in Control Center.

createdBy.description: The person who created the event.

createdDate.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the date and time when the event was created.

customerEventId.description: The user-specified ID for the event. See [Customer Event ID](https://techdocs.akamai.com/event-ctr/docs/concepts).

end.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the end date of the event.

id.description: The identifier of the event.

modifiedBy.description: The person who last modified the event.

modifiedDate.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the date and time when the event was last modified.

name.description: The name of the event.

objects.description: A collection of objects associated with the event.

items.description: Contains information about objects associated with the event.

oneOf.description: Contains information about a Content Provider (CP) code for the event.
oneOf.title: CP code

id.description: The identifier of the CP code.

name.description: The name of the CP code.

type.description: The type of event object. `CP_CODE` in this case.

oneOf.description: Contains information about a Flash Live stream associated with the event.
oneOf.title: Flash Live stream

bitrates.description: A list of expected bit rates in kbit/s for the stream.

cpCode.description: The Content Provider code assigned to the stream.

id.description: The identifier of the Flash Live stream.

name.description: The name of the stream.

type.description: The type of stream. `FLASH_LIVE_STREAM` in this case.

oneOf.description: Contains information about a Universal Live stream associated with the event.
oneOf.title: Universal Live stream

bitrates.description: A list of expected bit rates in kbit/s for the stream.

cpCode.description: The CP code assigned to the Universal Live stream.

id.description: The identifier of the Universal Live stream.

name.description: The name of the Universal Live stream.

type.description: The type of stream. `UNIVERSAL_LIVE_STREAM` in this case.

oneOf.description: Contains information about a Sure Route IP (SRIP) slot associated with the event.
oneOf.title: Sure Route slot

cpCode.description: The CP code assigned to the SRIP slot.

hostname.description: The Accelerated hostname associated with the SRIP slot.

id.description: The identifier of the SRIP slot.

type.description: The type of object. `SRIP_SLOT` in this case.

oneOf.description: Contains information about a Quality of Service (QoS) report pack associated with the event.
oneOf.title: QoS report pack

id.description: The identifier of the QoS report pack.

name.description: The name of the QoS report pack.

type.description: The type of object. `QOS_REPORT_PACK` in this case.

oneOf.description: Contains information about a Media Service Live 4 (MSL4) stream associated with the event.
oneOf.title: MSL4 stream

bitrates.description: A list of expected bit rates in kbit/s for the stream.

cpCode.description: The ingest Content Provider code assigned to the stream.

id.description: The identifier of the MSL4 stream.

name.description: The name of the MSL4 stream.

type.description: The type of stream. `MSL4_STREAM` in this case.

start.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the start date of the event.

tags.description: A collection of tags associated with the event.

id.description: The identifier of the tag.

name.description: The description of the tag.

400.description: Invalid request. Details may be available in response body.

schema.description: Provides information about an error response returned by the Event Center API.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem.

errors.description: A list of HTTP problem details. This field exists if there are multiple problems with a single request, and you want to call each of them out explicitly.

instance.description: The URI for this error occurrence.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

403.description: Insufficient permissions to access event or associated objects.

example.detail: Insufficient permissions to access UniversalLiveStream entity
example.title: Forbidden

schema.description: Provides information about an error response returned by the Event Center API.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem.

errors.description: A list of HTTP problem details. This field exists if there are multiple problems with a single request, and you want to call each of them out explicitly.

instance.description: The URI for this error occurrence.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

409.description: An event with same name, start and end already exists.

example.detail: An Event entity with the same name: 2018 Winter Olympics, start: 2018-04-23T04:00:00Z and end: 2018-04-23T04:30:00Z already exists
example.title: Entity already exists

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

get.description: Returns a list of events for the current account and contract type. This call supports paging and sorting of the result data.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Event Center API

schema.description: Contains a list of events for the current account and contract type. It also provides context about the requested data based on the request's parameters.

items.description: Contains information about an event including a list of tags associated with this event.

customerEventId.description: The user-specified ID for the event.

end.description: The end date of the event.

id.description: The identifier of the event.

name.description: The name of the event.

start.description: The start date of the event.

tags.description: A collection of tags associated with the event.

id.description: The identifier of the tag.

name.description: The description of the tag.

metadata.description: Collects context about the requested data based on the request's parameters.

pageSize.description: The number of records per page.

sort.description: Contains information about the sorting property and the sorting direction for the result data.

direction.description: The sorting direction for the result data. Either `asc` for alphabetically ascending order or `desc` for alphabetically descending order.

property.description: The sorting property for the result data.

400.description: Invalid request. Details may be available in response body.

schema.description: Provides information about an error response returned by the Event Center API.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem.

errors.description: A list of HTTP problem details. This field exists if there are multiple problems with a single request, and you want to call each of them out explicitly.

instance.description: The URI for this error occurrence.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

parameters.description: The inclusive lower bound of a start date.
parameters.name: minStart

parameters.description: The exclusive upper bound of a start date.
parameters.name: maxStart

parameters.description: The exclusive lower bound of an end date.
parameters.name: minEnd

parameters.description: The inclusive upper bound of an end date.
parameters.name: maxEnd

parameters.description: A list of tags to filter event data by.
parameters.name: tag

parameters.description: A list of user-defined IDs to filter event data by.
parameters.name: customerEventId

parameters.description: The number of the page. Page numbers start at 1.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The number of records on a page. By default, a page has 25 records. The maximum value is 1000 records on a page.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The sorting property and the sorting direction for the result data. Use `name` to sort by name. Use `asc` for alphabetically ascending order or `desc` for  alphabetically descending order.
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Contains information about the request body parameters that you can specify when updating an event. It also includes tags and objects that you can associate with an event.

audienceLocations.description: A list of two-letter ISO 3166 country codes that indicate geographic areas of audiences. This array can be up to 20 unique items.

audienceSize.description: The audience's size for the event. The minimum value is 1.

coordinators.description: A list of up to 20 Luna Control Center usernames of those who serve as the event's coordinators.

customerEventId.description: The user-specified ID for the event. This ID can be up to 100 characters long. [Customer Event ID](https://techdocs.akamai.com/event-ctr/docs/concepts).

description.description: The description of the event. This description can be up to 2000 characters long.

end.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the end date of the event.

name.description: The name of the event. This name can be up to 750 characters long.

objects.description: A collection of objects associated with the event. This array can include only unique items.

items.description: Contains information about the domain object related to an Akamai product that you can associate with the event.

bitrates.description: A list of expected bit rates in kbit/s for the stream. Specify for `FLASH_LIVE_STREAM`, `UNIVERSAL_LIVE_STREAM`, and `MSL4_STREAM` objects. This array can be up to 20 unique items.

id.description: The identifier of the object.

type.description: The type of object for the event. Use `QOS_REPORT_PACK` for quality report pack, `CP_CODE` for a Content Provider code, `SRIP_SLOT` for a Sure Route IP slot, `FLASH_LIVE_STREAM` for a Flash Live stream, `UNIVERSAL_LIVE_STREAM` for a Universal Live stream, or `MSL4_STREAM` for Media Services Live v4.1 stream.

start.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the start date of the event.

tags.description: A list of tags associated with the event. A tag can be up to 100 characters long. This array can be up to 20 unique items.

version.description: The version of the event. Use the `version` of the event sent in the original server's response. See [Event Version](https://techdocs.akamai.com/event-ctr/docs/concepts).

name.description: The description of the tag.

metadata.description: Collects context about the requested data based on the request's parameters.

pageSize.description: The number of records per page.

sort.description: Contains information about the sorting property and the sorting direction for the result data.

direction.description: The sorting direction for the result data. Either `asc` for alphabetically ascending order or `desc` for alphabetically descending order.

property.description: The sorting property for the result data.

parameters.description: The sorting property and the sorting direction for the result data. Use `name` to sort by name. Use `asc` for alphabetically ascending order or `desc` for  alphabetically descending order.
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey
